message.content: {"id": "37021", "title": "Bug 37021: Source path wrong in declare warning on binary files", "description": "When running tests on binary files in the tests/new/binaryWarnings/ directory, I encountered a problem with the source path being incorrect in the declare warning messages. The problem seems to occur when targeting .class files from injars. Instead of listing the source path as 'app/Main', it is shown as 'app.Main.class'. It is also worth noting that in some cases, the filenames do not appear at all in the warning messages, although I was unable to reproduce this issue in the provided tests. This issue is not limited to the testing environment as I encountered it in AJDT as well. It is possible that AJDT omits the filename when it does not make sense in the context.", "OB": "The source path in the declare warning messages for binary files should be displayed as 'app/Main' instead of 'app.Main.class'. Additionally, the filenames should always be included in the warning messages.", "EB": "", "SR": ""}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '37021', 'title': 'Bug 37021source path wrong in declare warning on binary files', 'description': 'Bug 37021source path wrong in declare warning on binary files [java|aj]".See tests/new/binaryWarnings/.. for code to run to see the problem.Limitations of the tests: These tests return false positives when detecting this error because filenamechecking is not enabled in harness verification of messages. (I saw it in AJDT, so perhaps if the filename makes nosense to AJDT, AJDT simply omits it.) ', 'OB': 'In declare warning messages when targeting .class files from injars, the sourcepath is listed in the form "app.Main.class" rather than "app/Main. I have also see the filenames not appear at all, but these tests do notreproduce that problem. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
